p: In a recent molecular-docking study [ 91], different polyphenols present in food matrices, namely kaempferol, curcumin, demetoxicurcumin, quercetin, catechin, and epicatechigallate, were investigated as potential COVID-19 inhibitors, having shown inhibitory activity against SARS in in vitro studies [ 79, 81, 82, 83]. These molecules showed a high binding affinity to COVID-19 M pro, with low binding energies and inhibition constants. Kaempferol, a flavonol mainly present in tea and some vegetables (e.g., spinach, broccoli, cabbage) [ 102], showed the highest activity.
